sagethemes 0.0.0.9002
  • Reference

Continuous gradient color scales

Source: R/scale-colour-sage-c.R
scale_sage_c.Rd

These create a gradient of colors based on the high and low value of a given hue from within the list of Sage branded colors.

scale_colour_sage_c(
  ...,
  option = "royal",
  low = NULL,
  high = NULL,
  na.value = "grey50",
  guide = "colourbar",
  aesthetics = "colour"
)

scale_fill_sage_c(
  ...,
  option,
  low = NULL,
  high = NULL,
  na.value = "grey50",
  guide = "colourbar",
  aesthetics = "fill"
)

Arguments

...

Options passed to ggplot2::continuous_scale()
option

One of the Sage colors. See names(sage_colors) for a list.
low

Colours for low and high ends of the gradient.
high

Colours for low and high ends of the gradient.
na.value

Colour to use for missing values
guide

Type of legend. Use "colourbar" for continuous colour bar, or "legend" for discrete colour legend.
aesthetics

Character string or vector of character strings listing the name(s) of the aesthetic(s) that this scale works with. This can be useful, for example, to apply colour settings to the colour and fill aesthetics at the same time, via aesthetics = c("colour", "fill").

Examples

library("ggplot2")

df_na <- data.frame(
  value = seq(1, 20),
  x = runif(20),
  y = runif(20),
  z1 = c(rep(NA, 10), rnorm(10))
)

ggplot(df_na, aes(x, y)) +
  geom_point(aes(colour = z1)) +
  scale_colour_sage_c(option = "apple")


ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +
  geom_tile() +
  scale_fill_sage_c(option = "powder")
